intro: Corchorus aesticans, commonly known as the slender dock, is a herbaceous annual plant native to temperate regions of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring alternate, lance-shaped leaves with a hairy surface. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in late summer. Its roots are fibrous and have been used in traditional medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory properties. Corchorus aesticans thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along streambanks.
